intro: Eremogone otitoides, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its compact growth habit and ability to store water in its leaves make it well-suited for xeriscaping. Eremogone otitoides plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value.
